articles.headline: Kickstarter Employees Vote to Unionize in a Big Step for Tech
articles.snippet: Engineers and others at the crowdfunding platform voted narrowly to form a union, one of the first tech companies to do so.
articles.abstract: Engineers and others at the crowdfunding platform voted narrowly to form a union, one of the first tech companies to do so.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Employees at the crowdfunding platform Kickstarter voted on Tuesday to unionize, the first well-known technology company to take the step toward being represented by organized labor.
articles.byline: By Kate Conger and Noam Scheiber

articles.headline: As Trump Claims to Be Law of the Land, Barr’s Irritation Builds
articles.snippet: The president broadly asserted his authority of the criminal justice system, attacking law enforcement officials and issuing pardons.
articles.abstract: The president broadly asserted his authority of the criminal justice system, attacking law enforcement officials and issuing pardons.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump and Attorney General William P. Barr agree on one thing at least: The president is making the attorney general’s job much harder. What they don’t agree on: Mr. Trump sees no reason to stop.
articles.byline: By Peter Baker, Katie Benner and Sharon LaFraniere

articles.headline: Trump Grants Clemency to Blagojevich, Milken and Kerik
articles.snippet: The president also pardoned or commuted the sentences of eight others on Tuesday, including Edward DeBartolo, a former owner of the San Francisco 49ers.
articles.abstract: The president also pardoned or commuted the sentences of eight others on Tuesday, including Edward DeBartolo, a former owner of the San Francisco 49ers.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — President Trump, citing what he said was advice from friends and business associates, granted clemency on Tuesday to a who’s who of white-collar criminals from politics, sports and business who were convicted on charges involving fraud, corruption and lies — including the financier Michael R. Milken.
articles.byline: By Michael D. Shear and Maggie Haberman

articles.headline: ‘It’s Like the End of the World’
articles.snippet: At the Turkish border with Syria, tales of the desperation unfolding on the other side, where some 900,000 people are fleeing a Syrian assault.
articles.abstract: At the Turkish border with Syria, tales of the desperation unfolding on the other side, where some 900,000 people are fleeing a Syrian assault.
articles.lead_paragraph: REYHANLI, Turkey — A slight man in a cotton jacket, carrying a knapsack, shivered in the cold, waiting for the Turkish border gate to Syria to open.

articles.headline: Michael Bloomberg Has to Debate Without a Net
articles.snippet: Candidates are not permitted to haul field organizers or canapés or record-reframing ad campaigns onstage with them. So the former mayor will stand on his own.
articles.abstract: Candidates are not permitted to haul field organizers or canapés or record-reframing ad campaigns onstage with them. So the former mayor will stand on his own.
articles.lead_paragraph: For months, he has muscled into the Democratic primary with all the glossy ubiquity money can buy — the benevolent billionaire, in his ads’ telling, results-minded and liberal where it counts.

articles.headline: Cruise Giant Carnival Works to Manage Deepening Coronavirus Crisis
articles.snippet: Carnival could be hurt financially after passengers on two of its ships were found to be infected.
articles.abstract: Carnival could be hurt financially after passengers on two of its ships were found to be infected.
articles.lead_paragraph: The arrival of the Westerdam cruise ship in Cambodia seemed like cause for celebration.

articles.headline: Pardon Closes the Book on Michael Milken’s Case but Can’t Rewrite It
articles.snippet: An alternative narrative portrays Michael Milken, a symbol of 1980s greed, as a maverick crushed by the establishment. Even money won’t make that a reality.
articles.abstract: An alternative narrative portrays Michael Milken, a symbol of 1980s greed, as a maverick crushed by the establishment. Even money won’t make that a reality.
articles.lead_paragraph: By pardoning Michael R. Milken, a potent symbol of the “greed is good” 1980s and arguably the most significant white-collar criminal of his generation, President Trump has sent two powerful messages: When it comes to justice, money counts. And white-collar crime doesn’t really matter.

articles.headline: China Expels 3 Wall Street Journal Reporters as Media Relations Sour
articles.snippet: Beijing said it had revoked their credentials over a headline the newspaper published in its opinion pages.
articles.abstract: Beijing said it had revoked their credentials over a headline the newspaper published in its opinion pages.
articles.lead_paragraph: HONG KONG — China said on Wednesday that it would expel three Wall Street Journal reporters working in mainland China, a significant escalation of Beijing’s pressure on the foreign news media.
